intro: Ficaria ranunculoides var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Canary Islands. It features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
